qas.question: When Rurik past away, who took over?
Who declared Kiev "The mother of Rus citis'?
What year did Oleg conquer the Drevlians?
Who killed Rrik and claimed his kingdom?
Who wrote that Kiev was "The mother of Rus cities"?
Who did Oleg conquer in the 800's?
Who peaceably asked the Drevlians for a fur tribute?

context: <b4_0>Rurik<b4_0/> led the Rus' until his death in about <a0_0>879<a0_0/>, bequeathing his kingdom to his kinsman, <a1_0><a2_0><b5_0><b6_0>Prince Oleg<b6_0/><b5_0/><a2_0/><a1_0/>, as regent for his young son, Igor. In 880-82, Oleg led a military force south along the Dnieper river, capturing Smolensk and Lyubech before reaching Kiev, where he deposed and killed Askold and Dir, proclaimed himself prince, and declared Kiev the "mother of Rus' cities." Oleg set about consolidating his power over the surrounding region and the riverways north to Novgorod, imposing tribute on the East Slav tribes. In <a3_0>883<a3_0/>, he conquered the <b7_0>Drevlians<b7_0/>, imposing a fur tribute on them. By 885 he had subjugated the Poliane, Severiane, Vyatichi, and Radimichs, forbidding them to pay further tribute to the Khazars. <b8_0>Oleg<b8_0/> continued to develop and expand a network of Rus' forts in Slav lands, begun by Rurik in the north.
